channel.title: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?
channel.description: Well, I tried using Jarmaker, but noone will gelp me with that, so does anyone know how to make a client so that the mains files are hidden?

item.title: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“GrimReapersScythe, post:6, topic:306322”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=402485.msg2982306#msg2982306 date=1254684666]

You could have, but then anyone with a java decompiler could’ve edited your files, try adding an anti-leech before deleting the .javas. That way, when they decompile, they get multiple errors to fix, before editing your work.

No offense, but that still doesnt stop people. That just makes them transfer information for items, interfaces, npc’s, graphics, emotes, and objects to another client, and transfering the cache.
[/quote]

Huh?[/quote]

Basically, copy all hard-coded model information and interface information, files, cache, and transfer it to another client. And you surpassed the anti-leech in 2 minutes.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?

You could have, but then anyone with a java decompiler could’ve edited your files, try adding an anti-leech before deleting the .javas. That way, when they decompile, they get multiple errors to fix, before editing your work.

No offense, but that still doesnt stop people. That just makes them transfer information for items, interfaces, npc’s, graphics, emotes, and objects to another client, and transfering the cache.[/quote]

item.title: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?
item.dc:creator: @runescapepkserver runescapepkserver
item.description:
@runescapepkserver wrote:

So I have been trying to JAR my client, for basicly no reason and I could of just deleted the .javas…?

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?

item.title: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

  1. Jarring doesn’t hide files, just adds them to a Java Archive; which can easily be extracted with Winrar. If you want to make your files less leech-able, I suggest adding an anti-leech, and deleting and the .javas and just having the .classes.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone know how to make a Client less leechable?
